Package goClient

Class GoClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • goClient.GoClient

extends java.lang.Object
    Client for Networked Go Game.
    Author:
    Huub Lievestro

    • Constructor Detail

      • GoClient

        public GoClient()
        Constructs a new GoClient. Initialises the TUI, and asks some other settings.

    • Method Detail

      • getClientName

        public java.lang.String getClientName()

        public Stone getPlayColour()

      • getLocalBoard

        public Board getLocalBoard()

      • getOpponentLastMove

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts creating a connection, followed by the handshake as defined in the protocol. After a successful connection and handshake, the Client waits for the start of the game. Then the Client plays the game, till it is completed. If keepConnecting is true, the Client will then again try to start another connection When errors occur or when the user terminates the client, the client will terminate.

      • createConnection

        public void createConnection()
                      throws ExitProgram
        Creates a connection to the server. Requests the IP and port to connect to at the view (TUI). The method continues to ask for an IP and port and attempts to connect until a connection is established or until the user indicates to exit the program.
        Throws:
        ExitProgram - if a connection is not established and the user indicates to want to exit the program.
        Ensures
        serverSock contains a valid socket connection to a server

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes the connection by closing the In- and OutputStreams, as well as the serverSocket.

      • clearConnection

        public void clearConnection()
        Resets the serverSocket and In- and OutputStreams to null. Always make sure to close current connections via closeConnection() before calling this method!

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String msg)
                 throws ServerUnavailableException
        Sends a message to the connected server, followed by a new line. The stream is then flushed.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to write to the OutputStream.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - if IO errors occur.

      • readLineFromServer

        public java.lang.String readLineFromServer()
                                    throws ServerUnavailableException
        Reads and returns one line from the server.
        Returns:
        the line sent by the server.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - if IO errors occur.

      • sendHandshake

        public void sendHandshake()
                   throws ServerUnavailableException,
                          ProtocolException
        Handles the client-server handshake, according to the protocol This method sends the handshake and checks whether the server response is valid If the response is not valid, this method throws a ProtocolException.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - if IO errors occur.
        ProtocolException - if the server response is invalid.

      • waitForStartGame

        public void waitForStartGame()
        This client is waiting for the Server to start a Game.

      • sendQuit

        public void sendQuit()
              throws ServerUnavailableException
        Sends a message to the server indicating that this client will exit: ProtocolMessages.EXIT; Both the server and the client then close the connection. The client does this using the closeConnection() method.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - if IO errors occur.

      • displayGameResult

        public void displayGameResult​(char reasonEnd,
                              java.lang.String winner,
                              java.lang.String scoreBlack,
                              java.lang.String scoreWhite)
        Displays the game result to the TUI.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method starts a new GoClient.
        Parameters:
        args -
